title: DE Chunking Design
description: DE Chunking breaks down documents into smaller, manageable pieces that can be individually embedded and retrieved.
whatItDoes: DE Chunking splits documents into smaller segments based on various strategies like size, semantic boundaries, or structural elements. These chunks become the basic units for embedding and retrieval.
whyItMatters: DE The way you chunk documents significantly impacts retrieval quality. Good chunking preserves context, reduces noise, and ensures that relevant information is retrieved together.
challenges: DE Determining optimal chunk size for your specific use case
DE Preserving context across chunk boundaries
DE Handling documents with varying structures
DE Balancing chunk granularity with retrieval precision
DE Managing overlapping chunks to preserve context
